entry.title: Shift Happens is a beautifully designed history of how keyboards got this way
entry.quote: Marcin Wichary on his long quest to capture everything that shaped modern type.

entry.title: Ring Is Cashing In on the UFO Craze to Promote Its Surveillance Dystopia
entry.quote: The 'Million Dollar Sighting' contest will reward people for putting up cameras in their home and capturing irrefutable proof of extraterrestrials.

entry.title: Nobel Prize in medicine won by two scientists for ‘groundbreaking findings’ on mRNA Covid-19 vaccines
entry.quote: Karikó and Weissman published their results in a 2005 paper that received little attention at the time, it said, but later laid the foundation for critically important developments that served humanity during the coronavirus pandemic.

entry.title: Authors shocked to find AI ripoffs of their books being sold on Amazon
entry.quote: But glancing at a few passages revealed that Cellan-Jones had fallen victim to someone attempting to piggyback on his memoir by releasing a title with text apparently generated by artificial intelligence – one of an influx of AI titles since the emergence of ChatGPT enabled people to generate pages of text rather than bothering to write it.

entry.title: Why Timnit Gebru wants AI giants to think small
entry.quote: When a select few companies in Silicon Valley promise more than their technology can actually deliver, Gebru argues, it makes it even harder for smaller companies to compete.
